intro: Eriogonum tolmieanum, commonly known as the Tolmie's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences of pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Eriogonum tolmieanum is well adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
